Reviews.Title: “hugely misleading room description, do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: andda347
Reviews.Content: We booked the 2 room budget apartment which is described as being 40 square metres and having a double bed. The advertised photos of the room fitted with its description and were the reason I booked the hotel. When we opened the door to the room we thought we'd been given the wrong key as it was like walking into a cupboard. The room had a small pull out sofa bed with bedding for one made up which took up most of the room. After squeezing past this we found a single bed in the other equally small room. Given we'd booked a 40 sqm room with a double we returned to reception expecting to be given another set of keys to our actual room. Despite explaining the apparent mix up the receptionist advised us that that was our room and that she couldn't give us another room as the hotel was full but offered us 5 euro to make amends accepting that the advertised details for the room were misleading and that the photos on booking.com were off a larger more expensive room. Given this frank admission we asked whether we could cancel the booking but were told that wasn't possible and we would still have to pay for the room. Sensing our increasing frustration we were offered 10 euro to make amends. As you can imagine this went down like a lead balloon where upon the receptionist tried to justify the room saying we had booked a cheaper room and so could not expect it to be as nice as the more expensive rooms. Given the deadlock we asked her to call the manager and see what they could do thinking common sense would prevail. Disappointingly we were told the 10 euro offer stood and we could take it or leave it. Given we had already paid for the room we had no real option but to take the 10 euro. This is the worst hotel we have stayed in and I was appalled at the way we were treated when we were the ones who had been wronged. I do not recommedt that anyone stay here for the above reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Gideon2NY
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times. The location is great, right off the Ku-damm, and near a terrific German restaurant, Marjellchen. The rooms have always been extremely clean and staff could not be nicer. Not fancy, but a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and affordable”
Reviews.Author: GermanyNeedtotravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in December while on business in Berlin. Even though I had booked a single, they offered me a much larger room, since the hotel was by no means full. Kurfurst is conveniently located off the Ku-Damm in Western Berlin and blocks from a subway line and numerous restaurants within a short walking distance around Savignyplatz. The room was clean and the baths were up to standard. A simply breakfast was served, included in the price. Overall a pleasant stay with helpful staff in this clean and well-managed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: shannon c
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 weeks while visiting Berlin. We had an almost-2 year old with us. The staff were very friendly and helpful - providing a child's bed and highchair as needed. Rooms were cleaned daily - to a high standard. The room and bathroom were spacious and clean - with a small bar-fridge. (no kettle or microwave included). Beds were comfortable and the breakfast buffet superb (even after 3 weeks of eating it!) Lots of choice - breads, cheese, meat, cereal, eggs, yogurt, juice, tea, coffee... Close to bus and s-bahn transportation. Located in a more-expensive area of town for restaurants and shopping - but if you go over a few streets, things are a little cheaper. No place for children to play (other than the room), but there are many fun parks around - just need to do a little exploring. The zoo is close-by. We brought a stroller with us, and it "just" fit into the tiny elevator... 1 person, kid in the stroller and stroller- tipped at an angle. If not - there are 4 flights of stairs to climb... which could be an inconvenience if you have a larger stroller (we have babyjogger city mini). Wi-fi worked well and was a good price. Very tiny television, with only BBC and CNN in English. No a/c, but fan provided. Very highly recommended - with one child.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Christysdad
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to have helpful and friendly staff, a peaceful and spacious room inc fridge (provide your own kettle and tea bags!) and a lovely buffet breakfast. Just off Kurfurstendam, if you cross over said main road and go further down Bleibreustrasse, there is a supermarket on the left while the nearest S Bahn train station is along on the right. Close to the station is an excellent Turkish restaurant called "Mey" (or "Wey" - sorry). About no 46, I seem to remember. On the right anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and roomy”
Reviews.Author: stucindy
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were helpful and friendly. My room was large, clean and very comfortable. The bed was a little firmer than I am used to, but ok. Parking was either on the street, or at the parking lot at the end of the street. We had no problem with the security of the car. Lots of restaurants close by. Very easy to get around the city from here by either bus or metro. I would definitely recommend this pension.

Reviews.Title: “Probably, the best value in the area.”
Reviews.Author: XchocolateX
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful, the room was large and comfortable. The location was great. There was free internet, but one was not able to access email. The breakfast was not too exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: Juan_kipling
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from Berlin from the ITB fair, I stayed and had a good time, it's very well located and close by to the Messe - Berlin fair which was quite good for my type of business. The staff is kind (eventhough most of them only speak german) so it was a little bit hard to communicate with the cleanning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TravellingScribe
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for a two-night stay in Berlin in June. Very friendly & helpful reception (where I could leave my bag safely on the last day after checkout to catch a late train). I booked a single room but seemed to have been given a small double (2 single beds). Everything was very clean, good linen, spotless tiny but perfectly adequate bathroom with shower. A wallsafe and plenty of hangers in the cupboard. Breakfast was excellent value, especially considering it was included in the price I paid for the room (74 euros) and offered a wider selection than I would have expected (good cheeses, cold meats, hardboiled eggs, cereals, juices, breads and more). The location is excellent. Bleibtreustrasse crosses Ku'damm and is a street full of top fashion boutiques and restaurants. Continue along Bleibtreustrasse across the other side of Ku'damm and you'll come to the S-Bahn stop Savignyplatz which will link you to Berlin Hauptbahnhof...I trundled my overnight bag and didn't need a taxi. The only slight downside was that my room overlooked an internal courtyard of what I assume are privately owned apartments and, the weather being warm all windows were open, so one evening I had to listen to a loud conversation (very loud) which made sleep impossible. I was about to yell out of my window but they stopped on the stroke of midnight. By the way, make sure you check out the fascinating historic b/w photographs of Berlin that line the hotel's corridors. They are an exhibition in their own right.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located jst 20 yards from Ku'damm”
Reviews.Author: Freischutz
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not have been better situated. Close to Ku'damm just beyond Uhlandstasse and but a short walk from Savignyplatz S-Bahn station, giving access to virtually all parts of the city and beyond. Without fail, the staff were helpful. The rooms that we occupied (one on the third floor, just beyond reception: one on the first floor) were large and comfortably (but simply) appointed. The breakfast (taken in the room next to reception) was what one normally expects of a German hotel. A bonus was the is free internet access: the terminal is at a disused reception desk across the stairway from the current reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: expat-steph
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this terrific little hotel in May and can't fault it with anything. The rooms were very clean and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. I was one of the fortune one who had the only room with a balcony and on one warm evening pulled out some chairs and enjoyed a bottle of wine while soaking up the Berlin evening. This hotel could not be better located if you love shopping and the park was only a 25 minute walk away. Cafes and restaurants in all directions. Something to suit all budgets. The hotel also offers free Internet station. Great for checking email. I plan to go back in September.

Reviews.Title: “Great place/reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: WriterTraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Pension Kurfuerst on Bleibtreustrasse 34 in Berlin. The room was spacious with comfortable beds and a sofa, coffee table and chairs. The wardrobe also contained a safe and there were plenty of hangers. The shower, although somewhat small, had excellent water pressure. Breakfast included a variety of cold meats, cheeses, those wonderful German rolls, various cereals, juices, yogurts, fruit cocktail (good on the Muesli with yogurt) soft boiled eggs, crackerbrot, jams, jellies, coffee or tea, etc. etc. The family could not have been nicer and all the staff were friendly and helpful. The pension consists of two floors (3&4) with the reception on the 4th floor and internet available for guests on the 3rd floor. It's located about 25 yards off of Kurfuerstendamn with bus stops around the corner. We hadn't been to Berlin since the Wall came down and I much prefer this area to Mitte. This is the old West Berlin area and there are numerous restaurants and shopping, including KaDeWe, within walking distance. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pension Kurfuerst was a great place to stay close to Kurfuerstendamm with many good restaurants, cafe's and ethnic food places to enjoy. The rooms were large, bathrooms small but very functional and clean. Breakfast was excellent and included in the price. Management and reception staff were helpful and kind. We would definitely recommend this pension style hotel to anyone traveling to Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Kurfurst
HotelInfo.Address: Bleibtreustrasse 34, 10707 Berlin, Germany
